sentence.Network_en: I was assigned to Troop A of the 10th Cavalry.

sentence.Network_en: Two regiments of cavalry were called out to tame the crowds.
sentence.Network_cn: 调集了两个装甲兵团去威慑、控制人群。

sentence.Network_en: The Indian cavalry under Haig became a functionally efficient unit.
sentence.Network_cn: 黑格领导下的印度骑兵成为了一支高效执行任务的队伍。

entry.def: The cavalry is the part of an army that uses armoured vehicles for fighting.

entry.def: The cavalry is the group of soldiers in an army who ride horses.

means.word_mean: 1. troops trained to fight on horseback;

Sentence.sentence: Mounted cavalry (骑兵) replaced the chariot (二轮战车) on the battlefield around 1000 BC.

jushi.english: When the war came he was sent at once to join the cavalry at Curragh Camp in Ireland.
jushi.chinese: 战争爆发后，她被立即派往爱尔兰卡勒营的装甲部队。

jushi.english: The cavalry charged the hostile fort.
At on early age, he was sent off to join the cavalry.
jushi.chinese: 他很年轻时就被送去参加了骑兵。
